weeklyTopNews.title: New South Wales and the Northern Territory ready to open their borders to New Zealanders
weeklyTopNews.summary: In a few weeks residents of New Zealand will be allowed to visit New South Wales and the Northern Territory without having to quarantine.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria records seven more coronavirus cases and two deaths as the 14-day average continues falling
weeklyTopNews.summary: Metropolitan Melbourne's 14-day new case average is now 12.8. The target for reducing restrictions on the 19th is a 14-day average of 5 or lower.

weeklyTopNews.title: NSW records zero locally acquired coronavirus cases for fourth consecutive day
weeklyTopNews.summary: NSW has now gone four days without recording a single locally acquired COVID-19 case. However, testing rates remain quite low with school holidays set to start.

weeklyTopNews.title: Daniel Andrews says Victoria 'so, so close' to taking a 'big step' as state records just five new cases
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews today said that the state is close to taking a "really big step" after only announcing 5 new cases overnight. The 14-day rolling average of new cases in Metropolitan Melbourne is now down to 20.3.

weeklyTopNews.title: Curfew lifted and COVID-19 roadmap is ‘ahead of schedule’ as Melbourne inches towards end of lockdown
weeklyTopNews.summary: Metropolitan Melbourne moves into step two of eased restrictions, and Victoria Premier Daniel Andrews announced that step three would be brought forward by one week to October 19th.

weeklyTopNews.title: Daniel Andrews says he will have 'good news' on Melbourne's Covid restrictions on Sunday
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews has teased a further easing of coronavirus restrictions after Victoria announced only 12 new cases overnight.
